Class LaserGrid

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • files.LaserGrid
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class LaserGrid
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    This class contains and draws the grid for the laser game. It also loads the level from a file that is premade.
    Version:
    4 June 12th, 2012
    version 4 changes - button background white, changed alot of methods

    Variable Dictionary 

    Name                  Type                 Description
    grid                  int [] []            stores the grid
    parent                MainMenu             stores the instance of MainMenu
    gridButton            JButton[][]          stores an array of JButtons. Represents the grid.
    level                 int                  stores the level that the user is on.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LaserGrid

        public LaserGrid(MainMenu parent)
        The constructor for LaserGrid. This class first initializes the grid variable to be an array 10 by 10. It then calls the readLevel () method, which assigns values to the grid variable. The JPanel is set as not opaque, 520x520 pixels with the FlowLayout. It then creates a series of buttons using for loops that represents the grid. Sets up all images.
        Parameters:
        parent - stores the instance of MainMenu

    • Method Detail

      • imageCreator

        public javax.swing.ImageIcon[] imageCreator(java.lang.String path)
        Creates an array of images from the path
        Parameters:
        path - the path to get the image from
        Returns:
        Array of images

      • readLevel

        public void readLevel(int level)
        This class reads from a file and sets the grid variable with many objects in it. This method uses a nested for-loop to set different numbers to each cell. Variable Dictionary 
        Name                  Type                 Description
        header                String               stores the header of the file
        in                    BufferedReader       stores the instance of BufferedReader
        line                  String               stores a line in the file
        Precondition: The file is valid, not corrupted and is compatible with the game.
        Parameters:
        level - The level to read data from

      • run

        public void run()
        Animates the next jbutton if possible, otherwise checks if the user has won, or resets the grid.

      • animateLaser

        public void animateLaser()
        This method is called when the Play button is pressed on the game screen. When this method is called, it animates the laser from the laser emitter. It takes appropriate direction change when it hits an obstacle. After placing a laser on the grid, it then sets the appropriate icons to the buttons. If the laser hits the wall, the laser stops. If the laser reaches the laser collector, the level is won.

      • checkWin

        public void checkWin()
        Checks if the user has won the level, then calls winLevel in mainmenu

      • checkWin

        public boolean checkWin(int x,
               int y,
               int laserDir)
        Checks if the position and direction wins the level
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the grid
        y - the y coordinate of the grid
        laserDir - the direction of the laser
        Returns:
        true if the user has won, false if not

      • animateLaser

        public void animateLaser(int x,
                int y,
                int laserDir)
        Sets the current position to animate, continues until win or stops. Recursive.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the grid
        y - the y coordinate of the grid
        laserDir - the direction of the laser

      • resetLevel

        public void resetLevel()
        This method resets the level to the level in the file.

      • updateGrid

        public void updateGrid()
        Visually updates the grid based on the grid variable. It sets the ImageIcon to the appropriate image. The image names are the integer values of the final variables. This method can also be used to remove the laser animations from the grid.

      • setLevel

        public void setLevel(int level)
        This variable sets the level to a different value.
        Parameters:
        level - the level that the variable is to be changed to

      • isDrawing

        public boolean isDrawing()
        returns whether the lasergrid is currently running or not.
        Returns:
        true if running, false if not

      • getLevel

        public int getLevel()
        Returns the current level of the user.
        Returns:
        the level

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
        This method checks if the cell has a mirror in it. If there is a mirror in that cell, it rotates it clockwise 45 degrees. Variable Dictionary 
        Name                  Type                 Description
        temp                  String               stores the string representation of ae (the button name)
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        ae - stores the information about the action

      • stopDrawing

        public void stopDrawing()
        Tells it to stop drawing
